data.title: Scoring System Programmer WANTED : $10
data.solution:
P1 = 0
P2 = 0

n = int(input())
p_1 = input()
p_2 = input()
for i in input().split():
    _list = i
    if i == p_1:
        P1+=5
    else:
        P2+=5

N1 = p_1
N2 = p_2

if P1 > P2:
    print(f"{N1} : {P1}")
    print(f"{N2} : {P2}")
elif P1 == P2:
    print("Draw!")
else:
    print(f"{N2} : {P2}")
    print(f"{N1} : {P1}")
data.statement:
"Dear Reader, we are looking for a programmer to join our game-development team. We are currently developing a website for playing chess online. Much of the HTML and Frameworks have been created and the basic game mechanics are ready... there are just a few issues to resolve.

We would like a scoring system for [[n]] consecutive games played by two players. The scoring system should output the winner and their points above the loser and their points (See example below).

[[Winner]] {{:}} [[Points]]
[[Loser]] {{:}} [[Points]]
{{Draw!}} (if [[p1]] and [[p2]] have an <<equal score>>.)

<<For each loss, 0 points are given to the player>>. <<For each win, 5 points are given to the player>>.

You will be given a [[LIST]] containing the name of the winner of each game played.

 We have many developers vying for the position, and as such our boss would like the <<shortest code>> possible. We will give $10, and a place on our team, to the programmer with the best solution code.
Please submit your program here, where we can review your application and solution."

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] representing the number of consecutive games played.
<<Line 2:>> A string [[p1]] containing the name of the first player.
<<Line 3:>> A string [[p2]] containing the name of the second player.
<<Line 4:>> A string [[LIST]] containing the name of the winner for each of the [[n]] games played separated by spaces.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[Winner]] {{:}} [[Points]]
<<Line 2:>> [[Loser]] {{:}} [[Points]]

Or {{Draw!}} if both players' points are equal.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

"Dear Reader, we are looking for a programmer to join our game-development team. We are currently developing a website for playing chess online. Much of the HTML and Frameworks have been created and the basic game mechanics are ready... there are just a few issues to resolve.

We would like a scoring system for n consecutive games played by two players. The scoring system should output the winner and their points above the loser and their points (See example below).

Winner : Points
Loser : Points
Draw! (if p1 and p2 have an equal score.)

For each loss, 0 points are given to the player. For each win, 5 points are given to the player.

You will be given a LIST containing the name of the winner of each game played.

We have many developers vying for the position, and as such our boss would like the shortest code possible. We will give $10, and a place on our team, to the programmer with the best solution code.
Please submit your program here, where we can review your application and solution."
Input
Line 1: An integer n representing the number of consecutive games played.
Line 2: A string p1 containing the name of the first player.
Line 3: A string p2 containing the name of the second player.
Line 4: A string LIST containing the name of the winner for each of the n games played separated by spaces.
Output
Line 1: Winner : Points
Line 2: Loser : Points

Or Draw! if both players' points are equal.
Constraints
0 < n <= 10
p1 and p2 do not contain spaces.
Example
Input
1
Player
CPU
Player
Output
Player : 5
CPU : 0
